1:
An evil man speaks of his transgression from deep in his heart, \q there is no fear of God in his eyes.
\q
2:
For he comforts himself,\q thinking that his sin will not be discovered and be hated.


\q
3:
His words are sinful and deceitful;\q he does not want to be wise and do good.
\q
5:
Your covenant faithfulness, Yahweh, reaches to the heavens;\q your loyalty reaches to the clouds.
\q
6:
Your righteousness is like the mountains of God;\q your judgments are like the great deep.
\q Yahweh, you preserve both mankind and the animals.


\q
7:
How precious is your covenant faithfulness, God!\q Humanity takes refuge under the shadow of your wings.
\q
8:
They will be abundantly satisfied with the richness of the food of your house;\q you will let them drink from the river of your precious blessings.
\q
9:
For with you is the fountain of life;\q in your light we will see light.


\q
10:
Extend your covenant faithfulness fully to those who know you,\q your defense to the upright of heart.
\q
11:
Do not let the foot of the arrogant man come near to me.\q Do not let the hand of the wicked drive me away.
\q
12: Over there the evildoers have fallen;\q they are knocked down and are not able to get up.
